Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek pottery plate; white slip; dot frieze on top of rim; on floor, wide black band with added red and white bands; to centre, possible large lotus flower petals with dashes as filling ornament; exterior: traces of band on edge of rim; on wall, three bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 34, pl. 21, no. 32a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.106)
